comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: Just for the record. This unique picture is the only known picture of the Fokker V.44. This experimental design was the first design by Reinhold Platz for an shoulder wing passenger airplane seating 5 passengers. According to available data the passengers were seated in an open cabin (!), unfortunately unvisible in this head on view. The reason why this is the only known picture of this design is that the machine was wrecked before the first flight. The pictures originates from the Heinz Nowarra archive. Source: Peter M. Grosz and Volker Koos. Fokker Flugzeugwerke in Deutschland 1912-1921.
